page.title: 19LAKELAND TERRIERS LAMPLUGH
page.content: Cyril Tyson judges Lakeland Terriers. He also breeds them. His terriers all have names beginning with M. He feeds them on meat and hard boiled eggs. They are fed once a day unless they are pups that have left their mum and are under six months. For every dog he has one licence. He goes to sixty to seventy shows a year. He clips them one month before they are to be shown. The pups start their training at a very early age. The training starts with the pups chasing a dead sparrow through a pipe. When it gets to the end it is given a bit of meat. On average the bitches have seven pups at a time. If two dogs start to fight they can be parted if they are picked up and turned upside down. The kennels are cleaned out every morning.
